intro: Styphelia wetarensis, commonly known as the Wetar heath, is a flowering plant native to the island of Wetar in Indonesia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and is adapted to humid, tropical climates. Styphelia wetarensis is a low-growing shrub with evergreen foliage and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest for horticulturists and botanists alike.
